stants a, b and c calculated by Jade. It is clearly seen that the lattice constants a, b, and c decrease with increasing

ions are incorporated into the host lattice, the absorption spectra show a slight

ions are doped successfully into the host lattice, and it is consistent with

tion spectra is mainly attributed to the electro-negativity difference between Natrium and Terbium. Since, the
electro-negativity of Terbium is higher than that of Natrium (Pauling electro-negativity of Terbium is 1.1 and that
of Natrium is 0.98), and thus the electro-negativity difference between Na and O is larger than that of Tb and O.
